comments:
CIS240 is an introduction to computer architecture. The course begins bottom-up with transistors and computer hardware structures, then moves into primitive machine instructions, then ends with an introduction to the C language.

Students were not engaged by the professor, and found lecture both disengaging and difficult to follow. Professor Smith read off the slides versus giving an actual lecture. Most students felt it would be beneficial to post the Powerpoint lecture slides prior to class, to allow students to follow lecture better.

Students felt that too much time was spent reviewing concepts that they already considered basic knowledge at this level, and too little time going over new material.
